titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 15
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Bernardus Wissel de Indagine, Commentary on Peter the Lombard's Four Books of Sentences

watermark.term: Double line serpent with ox-head, similar to Piccard II:3, XVI no. 209.

p.note: Half of the paper pastedowns on both the left and front insides are covered by a parchment pastedown, which is folded around the back of the first and last quires and visible as a stub.

supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation in ink and modern foliation in pencil . Secundo folio: in medio semitarum iudicii

collation.catchwords: Catchwords are missing for several quires, perhaps on account of pages having been trimmed.

p.note: Across both paper and parchment pastedowns is written in a contemporary hand: Hunc librum accepit venerabilis magister Iohannes gherdes accomodato ex doctore B. wissel cuius anima in sancta pace quiescat quem mortuo eodem domino doctore B. mihi vt vni ex heredibus tradidit. Iohannes rede magister.

binding.p:
Contemporary blindstamped binding by a bookbinder at Rostock University: see Altmann (1972) and Schunke (1979–1979)
, Universitätsbuchbinder. Metal centrepiece at the front board. Torn brown leather over wooden boards; 4 spinebands and endbands.
Two old shelfmarks on the spine: 205 written directly on the leather in the middle of the spine and at the bottom a label with the current signum A 15.
binding.decoNote: On the there is one rectangular panel stamp filled with floral motifs repeated 4 times (Altmann (1972), p. 34, Plate I, Rautenplatte 13a) surrounded by a frame; the frame is tooled with a leaf border (Altmann (1972), p. 34, Plate 4, Laubstab 244a), top compartment not filled. On the the same floral motif is repeated twice inside a narrow rectangular panel, surrounded by double frames on either side and single frames above and below. All frames are filled with the same leaf border as on the LCO.
In a contemporary hand on the tail edges is written: Wesseli collecta.
On and traces from one lost on .
binding.condition: The leather covering is torn, both on the LCO and the RCO, showing the wooden board underneath, and is cracking along the spine. On the only one fan-shaped catchplate is in place, no name engraved, cf. Altman, "Bucheinbände"; metal centrepiece on the lost; the anchor plates show remnants of leather straps.

history.origin: Germany Rostock , 1461-1462, for the dating see colophons on , and .
history.provenance:
According to a note on the the manuscript belonged to Bernhard Wissel and might be his autograph, see Hedlund (1980)
. It was then given to Iohannes Gherdes (Johannes van Reden), magister in Rostock and a contemporary of Bernhard Wissel, see Stegmüller (1948)
, and Repertorium Academicum Germanicum (RAG) https://resource.database.rag-online.org/ngEU9V577DM38tauyDdt9Cqb5Ex.

According to Anna Wolodarski it could have belonged also to Benedictus Petri, canon of Skara and monk at Vadstena abbey who was sent as a missionary to Lappland in 1525, see Gejrot (1996)
. He matriculated at Rostock University in 1514, see Callmer (1988)
. In the copy of Johannes Gritsch, Quadragesimale, Nürnberg 1488 at the National Library (Inc Holm 493), which was evidently owned by Benedictus Petri, there are marginal notes by several hands, one of them (this in quire E bifolium 3r, 4v, 1br etc) is probably the same hand as in A 15, e.g. , . Inc Holm 493 was donated by Benedictus Petri to Sveno Jacobi (c. 1480-1556), bishop of Skara, who studied at Rostock University, see Callmer (1988)
. Sveno Jacobi also owned two other printed books bound by the same bookbinder at Rostock University, and both have his name engraved on the catchplates (cod. Holm. Ij:1a:1-2).

In the inventories from the Antiquities Archive, U 90:2 and U 90:4, the manuscript is listed as 205, which is written in ink on the third panel of the spine; in Berch's catalogue it has shelfmark A 15 (current signum).
history.acquisition: To the National Library in 1780 from Antiquities Archive.

msItem.title: Introduction to the Sentences
msItem.incipit: In nomine sancte et indiuidue trinitatis patris et filii et spiritus sancti. Amen. Aggressurus libros sentenciarum 4or habeo prelibare ...
msItem.explicit: Quod nobis omnibus concedat ideo ihesus christus pro salute nostra crucifixus verus deus in eternum benedictus. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Et tantum de principali et hoc et cetera.
msItem.note: Four paragraphs of varying lengths added after the final rubric by a contemporary hand, probably the same hand as in many marginal comments. Nicolaus Wentorp and Ludolphus de Wilden OP, see Stegmüller (1948) pp.185-186, are mentioned here.

msItem.title: Prologue
msItem.incipit: Cupientes aliquid de penuria ac tenuitate nostra cum paupercula et cetera. Iste liber sententiarum prima diuisione diuiditur in 3s partes videlicet in prologum tractatum et epilogum tractatus incipit ibi veteris ac noue legis ...
msItem.explicit: Capitulum autem dicitur quasi tocius sentencie caput vel principium ratio est quia breviter continet siue inchoat senteciam dicendorum etc.
msItem.note: After the final rubric follows Sequitur questio circa prologum et est illa Sequitur textus. The last two words have been crossed out.

msItem.title: Questions on the prologue
msItem.rubric: Vtrum sacratissima scriptura scientie tenens iura dei consideratiua simplicita sit practica et quo ad quid theorica uel magis speculatiua
msItem.incipit: Vtrum sciencia theologica de deo obiectiue consideratiua sit dicenda practica uel magis speculatiua Et videtur primo quod theologia non sit sciencia ...
msItem.explicit: ... ideo non erit practica nisi secundum quid speculatiua autem simpliciter est dicenda quod fuit conclusum.
msItem.note: The explicit is followed by: Sequitur tractatus inicium textus.

msItem.title: Commentary on Book 1
msItem.rubric: Veteris ac noue legis continentiam eciam atque eciam diligenti indagine et cetera
msItem.incipit: Expedito prohemio sequitur tractatus liber sentenciarum intitulatus venerabilis magistri anthonomasice sic dicti petri lumbardi et prima diuisione diuiditur in quattuor libros parciales
msItem.explicit: Si ergo volumus bene facere et mereri necesse est voluntatem nostram diuine voluntati tamquam prime sue regule per insecucionem recte racionis conformari quod fuit dicendum et cetera cui semper ut conformemur concedat nobis ihesus christus eterni patris filius cum spiritu sancto vnus deus in eternum gloriosus Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Et sic et finis primi libri sentenciarum in laude dei.
msItem.colophon: 4a feria 4or temporum post cineres uel dominicam inuocauit ab incarnacione domini Anno Mcccclxio.

msItem.title: Recommendation for the rector
msItem.rubric: Recommendacio rectoris facta in die Jeorgii martiris
msItem.incipit: Teste cassiano libro 2o epistolarum suarum nutrimentum virtutum est exhibicio premiorum …
msItem.explicit: primum igitur oremus pro benefactoribus et fundatoribus nostre alme uniuersitatis.

msItem.title: Introduction to Book 2
msItem.incipit: Principiaturus in secundum librum sentenciarum 4or faciam primo diuinum auxillium in omnibus neccessarium ...
msItem.explicit: Expeditis primis tribus veniam ad 4m quod est mihi difficillimum in quo habeo referre graciarum actiones In primis igitur et principaliter deo etc.
msItem.note: The explicit is followed by: sequitur littera.

msItem.title: Commentary on Book 2
msItem.rubric: Creacionem rerum insinuans scriptura deum esse creatorem iniciumque et cetera
msItem.incipit: Hic est liber secundus sentenciarum qui sic continuatur ad precedentem postquam in primo libro tractatum est de deo essencialiter in se secundum racionem sue naturalis perfectionis ...
msItem.explicit: ... pro fine istius secundi libri sententiarum inponendo altissimum dominum nostrum scilicet ihesum christum deuote exoremus ut obedientiam debitam prelatis nostris et precipue sibi creatori nostro sic seruemus ut per eum salutem impetremus et in eterna felicitate cum ipso iugiter regnemus Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Et sic est finis 2i libri sentenciarum in laudem omnipotentis dei
msItem.colophon: 5a feria 4or temporum post exaltationem crucis Anno domini Mcccclxio dominus sit semper benedictus

msItem.title: Recommendation for the dead
msItem.incipit: Cum ingratitudo sit maximum viciorum quia est inimica anime exinanicio meritorum virtutum dispersio beneficiorum perdicio ...
msItem.explicit: Oremus pro animabus nostrorum predecessorum et precipue benefactorum et membrorum de germio vniversitatis in christo defunctorum Et primum pro fundatoribus benefactoribus et rectoribus nostre alme universitatis Nominatim igitur recommendo deuotis etc

msItem.title: Introduction to Book 3
msItem.incipit: Aggressurus 3m librum sentenciarum diuina mihi fauente clemencia 4or sum facturus primo et in omnia premittam diuini auxillii inuocacionem ...
msItem.explicit: ... idem sol mistice christus ihesus dei patris eternus filius ex maria virgine de spiritu sancto et temporaliter incarnatus nunc et semper et in secula seculorum benedictus et glorificatus Amen.
msItem.note: After the text proper two further sentences are written with space in between: Quantum ad 3m sit questio pro replicacione facienda ista videlicet. Quantum ad 4m Expeditis primis tribus graciarum actiones sunt referende Referimus igitur magister meus reuerendus concurres et ego In primis et principaliter gratiarum actiones tam deuotas quam debitas omnipotenti deo.

msItem.title: Commentary on Book 3
msItem.rubric: Cum igitur venit plenitudo temporis ut ait apostolus misit
msItem.incipit: Iste est liber 3us sentenciarum Qui sic ad precedentes continuatur postquam in primo libro tractatum est de deo essentialiter in se secundum racionem sue naturalis perfectionis ...
msItem.explicit: ... illam autem leuitatem que est in iugo domini modo non sentiunt ii qui ex caritate et amore precepta noue legis obseruant quibus mediantibus ad promissa eterna scilicet ad vitam beatam perueniant quam nobis omnibus misericorditer concedat qui sine fine viuit regnat Amen Amen Amen et cetera et cetera
msItem.finalRubric: Et sic est finis in laude dei 3ii libri sentenciarum.
msItem.colophon: Anno domini Mcccclxijo in profesto mathie apostoli Completus legendo per magistrum Bernardum Wissell sacre theologie baccalarium formatum deo gracias in alma vniuersitate studii rostockcensis

msItem.title: A sermon for the dead
msItem.incipit: Quia sancta et salubris est pro defunctis exoracio et memoria ut a peccatis soluantur machab 12o potissime magister [?] dominico [?] missarum solempnia ex quo quia
msItem.explicit: ... tamen tenemur pro domesticis fidei et pro benefactoribus specialiter. Ideo nominatim recommendo devotissime etc.

msItem.title: Introduction to Book 4
msItem.incipit: In presenti actu diuino mihi suffragante presidio pro introitu in 4m librum sentenciarum 4or ordinarie faciam primo ipsum diuinum presidium deuotius implorabo …
msItem.explicit: Expedito primo et 2o scilicet diuini nominis inuocacione et sacre scripture precipue librorum sentenciarum aliquali recommendacione restat iam 3m quod est quandam questionem mouere et pertractare et in eius dissolucionem contra magistrum meum reuerendum magistrum hinricum schonen mecum concurrentem replicare Sit ergo questio hec in forma Vtrum etc require in sexterno foris Sequitur 4m scilicet graciarum actio Quo finito Sequitur littera in nomine domini

msItem.title: Commentary on Book 4
msItem.rubric: SAmaritanus enim wlnerato approprians curacioni eius sacramentorum
msItem.incipit: Iste est liber 4us sentenciarum. Qui sic ad precedentes continuatur postquam in primo libro tractatum est de deo essencialiter in se secundum racionem sue naturalis perfeccionis qui in actum est de prelacione dei presidentis Et in 2o detractatum est de eo secundum quod potencia sua relucet specialiter in opere creacionis
msItem.explicit: ... de hiis autem remediis piissimis magister sentenciarum in 4o libro pertractat in quo agitur de sacramentorum efficacia et institucione et eorum salutifera administracione de futura iudicio et mortuorum resurrexione de tormentis malorum et eorum punicione de gloria beatorum et eorum premiacione que consistit in dei benefica visione et fructifera dileccione quam nobis omnibus post hanc vitam miseram misericorditer tribuat dominus noster ihesus christus dei et hominis filius nunc et in eternum laudabilis et gloriosus Amen.

note.p: After the colophon three paragraphs of text are added by the same hand: Expeditis primis duobus veniam consequenter ad 3m quod est mihi difficillimum in quo habeo referre graciarum actiones. In primis semper et principaliter refero graciarum actiones omnipotenti deo tam deuotas quam debitas pro vniuersis donis mihi misero indigno ... et precipue illis magistris dominis et studentibus qui paruitatem nostram in lectionibus et aliis non dedignati sunt audire et visitare offerens me ad eorum beneplacita similia et maiora etc. Vadamus Cum domino
The lower left corner of is detached resulting in some textloss.

msItem.colophon: Et sic finiuntur 4or libri sentenciarum quos legendo penetrauit Magister Bernardus Wessell de Indagine sacre theologie baccalareus formatus In studio florido et famoso vniuersitatis Rostokcensis Sub Anno domini Mcccclxiio in die Eufemie beate martiris Deus sit benedictus

msItem.title: Ab urbe condita, short excerpt
msItem.note: Eight lines of text from Titus Livius, Ab urbe condita, 29.18.3-7 added on a previously blank page.

p.note: Tabs on and traces from one lost on .

watermark.term: Oxhead with eyes, nostrils and elevated simple star, similar to Briquet 15054.
Bunch of grapes, similar to Briquet 12998.
Crown with elevated middle and three leaves, similar to Piccard I, I, no. 323.

supportDesc.condition: The unfoliated leaves of the first and last original quires have been cut or ripped out, leaving only the top, inner corners intact.

layout.note: Lines counted on (48 lines) and (54 lines). Column guidelines in pencil visible on some pages.

p.note: By a contemporary hand is written a conditional clause, whose main elements have three alternatives. The beginning of the sentence is missing on account pages having been ripped out.
Corrections and/or added notes in the margins on almost every page, made both by the main hand and at least one other contemporary hand.
References to Patrologia Latina in pencil added by a modern hand.

decoDesc.p: Rubrics underlined and capitals touched with red on .
decoDesc.decoNote: Red 4-line initials on and , the latter with a man's face inside the the counter space of the letter C. From and onwards, 3- and 4-line initials are outlined in black ink but not filled in, or lacking altogether. On a man's face has been drawn in the counter space of the initial c.
